text.div:
This code system https://fhir.dk.swisstph-mis.ch/matchbox/fhir/CodeSystem/emcare-custom-codes defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinition
EmCare.A.DE01 National Unique identificationUnique identifier provided or a universal ID, if used in the country
EmCare.A.DE03 Child's Identity unknown/prefer to remain anonymousThe client's identity is unknown or the client's prefers to remain anonymous
EmCare.A.DE04 First NameClient's first name
EmCare.A.DE05 Middle NameClient's middle name
EmCare.A.DE06 Last NameClient's family name or last name
EmCare.A.DE11 Date of Birth not knownThe client and/or Caregiver does not know the date of birth of the client
EmCare.A.DE12 Provide an estimated age or estimated date of birthThe client/Caregiver will provide an estimated age or estimated date of birth
EmCare.A.DE15.1 Estimated Date of BirthEstimated Date of Birth of the Client
EmCare.A.DE08 Consolidated Date of BirthEstimated Date of Birth of the Client
EmCare.A.DE16 SexThe Sex of the client
EmCare.A.DE48 Caregiverthe child could have been created from the mother therefore a relatedpersom may already exist select_one RelatedPerson candidateExpression
emcarerelatedpersoncaregiverid
EmCare.A.DE21 Caregiver First NameThe client's Caregiver's first name
EmCare.A.DE22 Caregiver Middle NameThe client's Caregiver's middle name
EmCare.A.DE23 Caregiver Last NameThe client's Caregiver's last name
EmCare.A.DE35 Primary Caregiver's Mobile telephone numberClient's Caregiver's mobile telephone number
EmCare.A.DE24 Caregiver's Relationship to ClientThe relationship of the Caregiver to the client
EmCare.A.DE31 Biological Mother Vital StatusThe client's mother and father's vital status
EmCare.A.DE32 Biological Father Vital StatusThe client's mother and father's vital status
EmCare.A.DE38 Caregiver wants to receive SMS or other messages regarding the child's visits and health statusThe Caregiver wants to receive SMS or other messages regarding the client's contacts/visits and health status
EmCare.B3.DE01 Reason for ConsultationThe reason for the client's consultation
EmCare.B3.DE05 Is the child sick Today?The client's visit is for a well child but the child is also presenting as sick
EmCare.B3.DE06 Type of ConsultationThe client's visit is for a new consultation
EmCare.B7.DE02 Convulsing NowThe client is convulsing now
EmCare.B7-B8-B9.DE01 Continue to Assess Sick ChildThe healthcare worker chooses if they will continue to assess the sick child with a life threatening illness
EmCare.B7.DE03 Convulsion(s) in this IllnessThe client is reported to have had one or more convulsions
EmCare.B7.DE08b Unconscious or LethargicThe client is unconcious or Lethargic
EmCare.B7.DE08 UnconsciousThe client is unconcious
EmCare.B7.DE08a LethargicThe client is lethargic
EmCare.B7.DE09 Not able to drink or breastfeedThe client has reported not to have been able to drink or breastfeed or currently is not able to drink or breastfeed.
EmCare.B7.DE10 Vomiting EverythingThe client is reported to be vomiting everything or vomiting but not everything or no vomiting
EmCare.B6.DE01 Axillary Temperature (degrees Celcius)The client's axillary temperature in degrees Celsius (temperature taken under the armpit)
EmCare.B6.DE04 Thermometer not availableA thermometer is not available to accurately measure the client's temperature
EmCare.B6.DE05 Hot to TouchThe client is hot to touch
EmCare.B6.DE01A Measured TemperatureThe client's Temperature has been measured
EmCare.B6.DE06 Weight (Kg)The client's weight in Kilograms
EmCare.B6.DE07 Weight cannot be measuredThe client's weight cannot be measured
EmCare.B6.DE08 Estimated WeightThe client's weight has been estimated - to be used for treatment dosing only
EmCare.B6.DE10 Prefer to measure lengthThe health care worker would prefer to measure the client using length
EmCare.B6.DE09 HeightThe client's height in Centimeters
EmCare.B6.DE11 Height cannot be measuredThe client's height cannot be measured
EmCare.B6.DE12 LengthThe client's length in Centimeters
EmCare.B6.DE13 Length cannot be measuredThe client's length cannot be measured
EmCare.B6.DE16 Weight for Age (WFA) Z ScoresThe client's weight for age z score
EmCare.B6.DE17 MUAC (mm)The client's Mid Upper Arm Circumference in Millimeters (child â‰¥6 months old)
EmCare.B6.DE17a MUAC cannot be measuredThe client's Mid Upper Arm Circumference cannot be measured
EmCare.B6.DE18 Visually assess for whether underweight (for drug dose calculation)The health care worker visually assesses for whether underweight (for drug dosing calculations)
EmCare.B7.DE03 Convulsion(s) in this IllnessThe client is reported to have had one or more convulsions
EmCare.B18S1.DE02 Difficulty with FeedingThe client is reported to have difficulty with Feeding
EmCare.B11S1.DE01 DiarrhoeaThe client is reported to have diarrhoea
EmCare.B21S1.DE06 BreastfedThe client is breastfed
EmCare.B18S2.DE07 Severe Chest IndrawingThe client has severe chest indrawing
EmCare.B18S2.DE08 MovementsThe health care worker's assessments of the client's movements
EmCare.B18S2.DE12 Umbilicus Red or Pus DrainingThe client's umbilicus is red or is draining pus
EmCare.B18S2.DE13 Skin PustulesThe client has skin pustules
EmCare.B19S2.DE01 Yellow SkinThe client has yellow skin
EmCare.B19S2.DE02 Yellow Palms or Yellow SolesThe client has yellow palms or yellow soles
EmCare.B19S2.DE04 When did the Jaundice first appear?The age at which the Jaundice first appeared
EmCare.B11S2.DE01 Sunken EyesThe client has sunken eyes
EmCare.B11S2.DE02 Skin pinch of AbdomenThe healthcare worker pinches the skin of the client's abdomen for 1 second and then observes how long the skin takes to return to normal once released
EmCare.B11S2.DE06 Restless and IrritableThe client is restless and irritable
EmCare.B21S2.DE01 Weight StatusThe client's weight status
EmCare.B21S2.DE05 Breastfed how many times in 24 hours?Number of times the client is breastfed in 24 hours
EmCare.B21S2.DE06 Sufficient feedsBased on the number of feeds during a 24 hour period the result is auto-calculated to determine sufficient feeds
EmCare.B21S2.DE08 Young Infant receives food or fluids other than breast milkThe client is receiving other food or drinks besides breastmilk
EmCare.B21S2.DE09 What milk is being given as a replacement feed?The health care worker discusses the milk being given to the client as a replacement feed and determines if it is appropriate replacement milk
EmCare.B21S2.DE12 How many replacement feeds during the day and night (24 hours)?How often the client is receiving replacement feeds during the day and night (24 hours)
EmCare.B21S2.DE13 Sufficient replacement feeds (in 24 hours)Based on the number of feeds during the day and night (24 hours) the result is auto-calculated to determine sufficient replacement feeds
EmCare.B21S2.DE15 How much milk is given at each feed (ml)?The amount of milk given to the client at each feed
EmCare.B21S2.DE16 Sufficient replacement feedsThe care giver is giving sufficient replacement feeds
EmCare.B21S2.DE18 How is the milk prepared?Description of how the milk is prepared for the client's feed
EmCare.B21S2.DE21 How is the milk given?Description on how the client is given the milk - bottle or cup
EmCare.B21S2.DE24 How are the feeding utensils cleaned?Description of how the feeding utensils are cleaned
EmCare.B21S2.DE27 Do you give any breastmilk at all?Does the care giver give the client any breastmilk at all?
EmCare.B21S2.DE30 Ulcers or White Patches in MouthThe client has ulcers or white patches in the mouth
EmCare.B21S2.DE31 Unable to check if Ulcers or White Patches in MouthThe healthcare worker is unable to check if the client has ulcers or white patches in the mouth
EmCare.B10S1.DE05 CoughThe client is reported to have or has had a cough
EmCare.B10S1.DE06 Cough for how long?Length of time the client is reported to have or has had the cough
EmCare.B10S1.DE01 Difficulty BreathingThe client is reported to have or has had difficulty breathing
EmCare.B10S1.DE02 Difficulty breathing for how long?The length of time the client has or has had difficulty breathing
EmCare.B11S1.DE01 DiarrhoeaThe client is reported to have or has had diarrhoea
EmCare.B11S1.DE02 Diarrhoea for how long?The length of time the client is reported to have or has had diarrhoea
EmCare.B11S1.DE05 Blood in the stool in this IllnessThe client is reported to have or has had blood in the stool in this Illness
EmCare.B12S1.DE02 Fever ReportedThe client is reported to have or has had fever
EmCare.B12S1.DE03 Fever for how long?
EmCare.B.G.DE06 Fever
EmCare.B12S1.DE06 Has Fever been present every day since the Fever started?The client has had fever present every day since the fever started
EmCare.B13S1.DE01 Ear problemThe client is reported to have had or has an ear problem
EmCare.B13S1.DE02 Ear painThe client is reported to have had or has ear pain
EmCare.B13S1.DE03 Ear dischargeThe client is reported to have or has had ear discharge
EmCare.B13S1.DE04 Ear discharge for how long?The length of time client has or has had ear discharge
EmCare.B14S1.DE03 Eye ProblemThe client is reported to have an eye problem
EmCare.B14S1.DE01 Skin ProblemThe client is reported to have or has had a skin problem
EmCare.B14S1.DE02 Itchy SkinThe client is reported to have itchy skin
EmCare.B22.RespiratoryRate The client's respiratory rate
EmCare.B10S2.DE03 Chest IndrawingThe client has chest indrawing
EmCare.B10S2.DE04 Stridor in a calm childThe client has stridor in a calm child while the client is at rest
EmCare.B10S2.DE05 WheezingThe client is wheezing
EmCare.B10S2.DE06 Recurrent WheezeThe client has experienced recurrent wheeze
EmCare.B10S2.DE07 Oxygen SaturationThe client's oxygen saturation measurement
EmCare.B10S2.DE08 Oxygen Saturation < 90 %The client's oxygen saturation is less than 90 %
EmCare.B11S2.DE01 Sunken eyesThe client has sunken eyes
EmCare.B11S2.DE02 Skin pinch of AbdomenThe healthcare worker pinches the skin of the client's abdomen for 1 second and then observes how long the skin takes to return to normal once released
EmCare.B11S2.DE06 Restless and IrritableThe client is restless and irritable
EmCare.B17S1.DE01 Throat problemThe client has a throat problem
EmCare.B17S1.DE02 Specify Throat problemSpecify the throat problem the client has
EmCare.B17S1.DE06 Enlarged lymph nodes on front of neckThe client has enlarged lymph node(s) on the front of the neck
EmCare.B17S1.DE07 Ability to swallowThe client's ability to swallow
EmCare.B13S2.DE01 Tender swelling behind the earThe client has tender swelling behind the ear
EmCare.B13S2.DE02 Pus Seen Draining from the EarThe client has pus draining from the ear which has been seen by the health care worker
EmCare.B13S2.DE03 Pus Seen Draining from the Ear for how long?The length of time the client has or has had pus draining from the ear
EmCare.B12S2.DE01 Stiff neckThe client has a stiff neck
EmCare.B12S2.DE05 Runny noseThe client has a Runny nose
EmCare.B14S2.DE01 Red eyesThe client has red eyes

EmCare.B14S2.DE06 Generalised or Localised Skin ProblemThe client has a generalised or localised skin problem

EmCare.B6.DE19 does not appear to be underweightThe client is visually assessed for whether underweight by the health care worker and does not appear to be underweight (estimated weight based on height or age would be equivalent to WHZ= 0 / WAZ= 0)

EmCare.B15S2.DE10 severe mucous membrane pallorThe client has severe mucous membrane pallor
EmCare.B15S2.DE11 some mucous membrane pallorThe client has some mucous membrane pallor
EmCare.B15S2.DE12 no mucous membrane pallorThe client has no mucous membrane pallor
EmCare.B14S2.DE07 generalised skin problemThe client has a generalised skin problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE08 localised skin problemThe client has a localised skin problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE09 no problemThe client does not have a generalised or localised skin problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE18 papular urticaria or papular pruritic eruptionsThe client has Papular Urticaria or Papular Pruritic Eruptions â€¢ Itchy papules at different stages of evolution. â€¢ Found on the arms and legs. â€¢ Healed lesions are often dark/ hyperpigmented. â€¢ The itch is difficult to manage. â€¢ Essential to exclude scabies.
EmCare.B14S2.DE19 ringworm (tinea)The client has Ringworm (Tinea) - â€¢ An itchy circular lesion with a raised edge and fine scaly area. â€¢ Scalp lesions may result in loss of hair
EmCare.B14S2.DE21 scabiesThe client has Scabies - â€¢ Intense itching, more severe at night. â€¢ Small burrows between fingers, tows, elbow areas and buttocks. â€¢ Secondary infection may occur. â€¢ Small babies may have vesicles and pustules on the palms and soles and face. â€¢ The infestation spreads easily, usually affecting more than one person in the household
EmCare.B14S2.DE22 chickenpoxThe client has Chickenpox - Mild fever preceding the rash. â€¢ Rash begins on the trunk and face, later spreads to the arms and legs. â€¢ Vesicles appear progressively over days and forms scabs after they rupture. â€¢ Contagious from the fever starts until all lesions have crusted. â€¢ Usually lasts for about 1 week.
EmCare.B14S2.DE23 herpes zosterThe client has Herpes Zoster - Vesicles in one area on one side of body with intense pain or scars plus shooting pain. â€¢ They are uncommon in children except when they are immune-compromised
EmCare.B14S2.DE25 impetigoThe client has Impetigo- Pustules and papules with honey -coloured crusts. â€¢ Commonly starts on the face or buttocks, then spreads to the neck, hands, arms and legs.
EmCare.B14S2.DE31 molluscum contagiosumThe client has Molluscum Contagiosum -Caused by a poxvirus. â€¢ Dome-shaped papules with a central depression (umblication). â€¢ Most commonly seen on the face and trunk in children
EmCare.B14S2.DE32 wartsThe client has Warts - Appears as papules or nodules with a rough surface. â€¢ Seen most often on the hands and fingers, but can be found anywhere on the body.
EmCare.B14S2.DE33 seborrhoeic dermatitisThe client has Seborrhoeic Dermatitis - Greasy scales and redness on central face, body folds. â€¢ The scalp, face, ears and skin folds (e.g. axillae, groins, under the breasts) are commonly affected.
EmCare.B14S2.DE35 fixed drug reactionThe client has Fixed Drug Reaction - One or more dark round or oval skin lesions with central vesicles . â€¢ The lesions recur on the same spot, and increase in number with each successive attack
EmCare.B14S2.DE36 eczemaThe client has Eczema - Erythematous (red), sometimes scaly plaques found on the face, flexures, trunk and extensors. â€¢ Yellow pustules which crust indicate secondary bacterial infection.
EmCare.B14S2.DE37 steven johnson syndrome (sjs)The client has Steven Johnson Syndrome (SJS) - Severe and acute reaction due to many drugs, the commonest being cotrimoxazole or nevirapine. â€¢ Lesions involve the skin as well as the mucous membranes (e.g. eyes, mouth and genitalia). â€¢ May start as widespread red irregular rash with or without blisters. The blisters rupture leaving denuded areas of skin. â€¢ May cause difficulty in breathing.
EmCare.B14S2.DE44 skin problemThe health care worker would like to add a skin problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE45 oral sores or mouth ulcersThe health care worker would like to add an Oral Sores or Mouth Ulcers problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE46 eye problemThe health care worker would like to add an Eye problem
EmCare.B14S2.DE47 no - do not add a skin or mouth or eye problemThe healthcare worker would not like to add a Skin or Mouth or Eye Problem
EmCare.B21S2.DE29 no breastmilk at allThe caregiver does not give the client any breastmilk at all
EmCare.B21S2.DE11 inappropriate replacement milkThe care giver is giving inappropriate replacement milk
EmCare.B21S2.DE10 appropriate replacement milkThe care giver is giving appropriate replacement milk

EmCare.B22.DE19 respiratory rate (post inhaled bronchodilator trial)
EmCare.B22.DE20 fast breathing (post inhaled bronchodilator trial)
EmCare.B22.DE21 no fast breathing and no chest indrawing (post inhaled bronchodilator trial)

concept.display: does not appear to be underweight
concept.definition: The client is visually assessed for whether underweight by the health care worker and does not appear to be underweight (estimated weight based on height or age would be equivalent to WHZ= 0 / WAZ= 0)

The client is visually assessed for whether underweight by the health care worker and appears to be underweight (as an aide for dosing calculations) (estimated weight based on height or age would be equivalent to WHZ= -1 / WAZ= -1)

The client is visually assessed for whether underweight and appears to be severely underweight (as an aide for dosing calculations) (estimated weight based on height or age would be equivalent to WHZ= -2 / WAZ= -2)

concept.display: papular urticaria or papular pruritic eruptions
concept.definition:
The client has Papular Urticaria or Papular Pruritic Eruptions 
â€¢ Itchy papules at different stages of evolution.
â€¢ Found on the arms and legs.
â€¢ Healed lesions are often dark/ hyperpigmented.
â€¢ The itch is difficult to manage.
â€¢ Essential to exclude scabies.

The client has Ringworm (Tinea) - 
â€¢ An itchy circular lesion with a raised edge and fine scaly area.
â€¢ Scalp lesions may result in loss of hair

The client has Scabies -
â€¢ Intense itching, more severe at night.
â€¢ Small burrows between fingers, tows, elbow areas and buttocks.
â€¢ Secondary infection may occur.
â€¢ Small babies may have vesicles and pustules on the palms and soles and face.
â€¢ The infestation spreads easily, usually affecting more than one person in the household

The client has Chickenpox - Mild fever preceding the rash.
â€¢ Rash begins on the trunk and face,
later spreads to the arms and legs.
â€¢ Vesicles appear progressively over days and forms scabs
after they rupture.
â€¢ Contagious from the fever starts until all lesions have
crusted.
â€¢ Usually lasts for about 1 week.

The client has Herpes Zoster -  Vesicles in one area on one side of body with intense pain or scars plus shooting pain.
â€¢ They are uncommon in children except when they are immune-compromised

The client has Impetigo- Pustules and papules with honey -coloured crusts.
â€¢ Commonly starts on the face or buttocks, then spreads to the neck, hands, arms and legs.

The client has Molluscum Contagiosum -Caused by a poxvirus.
â€¢ Dome-shaped papules with a central depression
(umblication).
â€¢ Most commonly seen on the face and trunk in children

The client has Warts - Appears as papules or nodules with a rough surface.
â€¢ Seen most often on the hands and fingers, but can be
found anywhere on
the body.

The client has Seborrhoeic Dermatitis - Greasy scales and redness on central face, body folds.
â€¢ The scalp, face, ears and skin folds (e.g. axillae, groins, under the breasts) are commonly affected.

The client has Fixed Drug Reaction - One or more dark round or oval skin lesions with central vesicles .
â€¢ The lesions recur on the same spot, and increase in number with each successive attack

The client has Eczema - Erythematous (red), sometimes scaly plaques found on the face, flexures, trunk and extensors.
â€¢ Yellow pustules which crust indicate
secondary bacterial infection.

The client has Steven Johnson Syndrome (SJS) - Severe and acute reaction due to many drugs, the commonest being cotrimoxazole or nevirapine.
â€¢ Lesions involve the skin as well as the mucous membranes (e.g. eyes, mouth and genitalia).
â€¢ May start as widespread red irregular rash with or without blisters. The blisters rupture leaving denuded areas of skin.
â€¢ May cause difficulty in breathing.
The health care worker would like to add a skin problem
The health care worker would like to add an Oral Sores or Mouth Ulcers problem
The health care worker would like to add an Eye problem

concept.definition: The healthcare worker would not like to add a Skin or Mouth or Eye Problem
